identificationModule.officialTitle: Elucidating the Relationship Between Ultra-Processed Food Consumption, Executive Function, and Hunger-Related Hormones

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to examine potential effects of a diet characterized by UPF on hunger-related hormones and executive function. It entails a two-arm, crossover, randomized controlled trial.

armGroups.label: Ultra-processed foods
armGroups.description: Participants are instructed to consume only ultra-processed foods for 3 days.

armGroups.label: Unprocessed foods
armGroups.description: Participants are instructed to consume only unprocessed foods for 3 days.

interventions.name: Education
interventions.description: Educational handouts on how to adhere to the corresponding diet.

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured in kilograms divided by meters squared
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured using a seca medical body composition analyzer (mBCA) 514 bioelectrical impedance scale, as a percentage
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured using a seca medical body composition analyzer (mBCA) 514 bioelectrical impedance scale, in pounds and kilograms
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured using a seca medical body composition analyzer (mBCA) 514 bioelectrical impedance scale, as a percetange
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured using a seca medical body composition analyzer (mBCA) 514 bioelectrical impedance scale, in pounds and kilograms
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Food addiction according to the Yale Food Addiction Scale Version 2.0
secondaryOutcomes.description: Presented as a symptom count (score range from 0-11, higher means more food addiction symptoms) and used to classify as "No," "Mild," "Moderate," or "Severe" food addiction
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Behavioral Inhibition System/Behavioral Approach System Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Score ranges from 20 to 80, with higher scores indicating greater behavioral inhibition and behavioral activation
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Executive Function: Tower Test (Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Total Achievement Score (range=0-30, higher = higher executive function)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Executive Function: Color-Word Interference Test (Delis-Kaplan Executive Function System)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Scaled inhibition/switching scores (score range=1-19, higher = higher executive function)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured as a percent of total calories, taken from 3-day diet records
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Measured at three times: baseline, post-first diet arm (3 days), post-second diet arm (6 days)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Adults aged 18-55
* Willing to consume an entirely ultra-processed and entirely unprocessed diet for 3 days each (6 days in total)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Chronic disease that interferes with study-related activities
* Special diet that limits adherence to the intervention diets
* Visual impairment not corrected by glasses/contacts
* Pregnant or lactating
